Ad Text:
Architect future-focused digital energy and grid-edge capabilities
Lead solutions across smart metering, DER, VPP and EV-charging enablement
6-month initial contract with strong extension options in a multi-year program

About the Opportunity


You'll shape and deliver architecture across advanced energy technologies including smart meters, DER integration, load control, VPP orchestration and EV enablement. Working closely with technology, field operations and commercial teams, you'll design secure, scalable and standards-aligned solutions that enhance customer services and real-time grid performance. This role requires strong utilities expertise and the ability to drive high-impact outcomes across complex operational and data environments.

What you'll do

Lead technical workshops and align stakeholders on architecture direction
Develop solution designs spanning AMI, DERMS, VPP and energy data platforms
Ensure compliance with architecture governance, security and performance principles
Recommend modern technologies, patterns and approaches to uplift capability
Support delivery teams through implementation, integration and migration phases

What you bring

Deep utilities experience across DER, smart metering, and/or energy control systems
Strong understanding of data flows between operational and digital platforms
Exposure to real-time control environments (e.g. load shedding, power quality)
Ability to present complex solutions clearly to technical and business audiences
Track record uplifting enterprise platforms or delivering major transformation

Please apply asap as we are shortlisting this week!

Job Title: Lead Data Engineer – AWS / Big Data / Cloud Transformation
Ad Text:
Join a high-performing Data team that’s driving a large-scale transformation program within the banking and financial services industry. This is an excellent opportunity for an ambitious and technically strong Data Engineer to play a lead role in shaping a modern, cloud-based data platform.

You’ll be joining a collaborative, forward-thinking environment where innovation, problem-solving, and technology excellence are at the heart of everything they do.

What you’ll be doing As a Lead Data Engineer, you’ll take ownership of major data initiatives, leading a team to modernise and optimise core data pipelines and platforms. You’ll combine strategic thinking with hands-on expertise to deliver scalable, automated, and efficient data solutions leveraging cloud and big data technologies.

Key responsibilities
Lead the design and delivery of end-to-end data engineering solutions across key transformation programs.
Guide and mentor a team of engineers to build efficient, high-quality data pipelines and integrations.
Drive platform optimisation through automation and AI capabilities.
Collaborate with architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to align solutions with strategic data objectives.
What you’ll bring
Deep Big Data and Hadoop experience with strong Spark, Hive, and Presto (or equivalent) skills.
Expert-level SQL, including query tuning and optimisation.
Proven experience implementing ETL/ELT solutions using tools like Talend, DataStage, or Informatica.
Strong AWS experience across EC2, S3, RDS, and EMR.
Sound understanding of data modelling, metadata management, lineage, and data quality frameworks.
Hands-on Python experience, particularly in automation and AI integration.
Why apply You’ll be part of an organisation that values collaboration, innovation, and technical excellence. This is a key leadership opportunity for someone passionate about modern data engineering, automation, and cloud transformation within a leading financial institution.

We are HCLTech, one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world and home to 219,000+ people across 54 countries, supercharging progress through industry-leading capabilities centered around Digital, Engineering and Cloud.

The driving force behind that work, our people, are diverse, creative, and passionate, raising the bar for excellence on a regular basis. We, in turn, work hard to bring out the best in them as we strive to help them find their spark and become the best version of themselves that they can be.

Are you ready to be an important part of this ever-transformational journey?

At HCLTech Australia, we value the unique perspective and contributions of all individual and we actively encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply for this role.

Job Role Overview:

3+ years of experience in Data Modeling or related fields.

Strong knowledge of Data Modeling concepts, techniques, and best practices.

Experience with Data Modeling tools (e.g., ERwin, ER/Studio, PowerDesigner).

Understanding of data warehousing concepts and dimensional modeling.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Experience with SQL and data manipulation languages.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.

Nice to Have:

Experience with big data and NoSQL databases.

Knowledge of data governance and data quality frameworks.

Certification in data modeling or related fields (e.g., Certified Data Modeler).

Experience with agile development methodologies.

Why Us

We are one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world, with offices in 50+ countries across the globe and 219,000 employees.

Our company is extremely diverse with 165 nationalities represented.

We offer the opportunity to work with colleagues across the globe.

We offer a virtual-first work environment, promoting a good work-life integration and real flexibility.

We offer comprehensive benefits for all employees.

We are a certified great place to work and a top employer in 17 countries, offering a positive work environment that values employee recognition and respect.

Equality & Opportunity for All

Representing 165 nationalities across the globe, we pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law.
